articles.author: Erin Banco
articles.description: The Palestinian militant group Hamas has recruited between 10,000 and 15,000 members since the start of its war with Israel, according to two congressional sources briefed on U.S. intelligence, suggesting the Iran-backed fighters could remain a persistent threat to Israel.
articles.title: Exclusive: Hamas has added up to 15,000 fighters since start of war, US figures show

articles.author: Vladyslav Smilianets And Sergiy Karazy
articles.description: As snow fell in a wooded area of Ukraine, the long-range attack drones accelerated one by one down an unlit, abandoned road and their whirring engines propelled them into the night sky.
articles.title: Inside the Ukrainian drone unit conducting deep strikes on Russia

articles.author: Humeyra Pamuk
articles.description: The U.S. State Department issued a "stop-work" order on Friday for all existing foreign assistance and paused new aid, according to a memo seen by Reuters, fulfilling an order issued by President Donald Trump.
articles.title: US stops work on foreign aid after Trump orders review

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Hegseth was confirmed after a 50-50 vote in the Senate, when Vice President JD Vance came to the chamber to break the tie.
articles.title: Hegseth narrowly wins confirmation to become US defense secretary

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Palestinian militant movement Hamas is expected to release four female Israeli soldiers on Saturday in exchange for a group of Palestinian prisoners under a ceasefire agreement aimed at ending the 15-month-old war in Gaza.
articles.title: Hamas set to release four Israeli soldier hostages in second swap

articles.author: Phil Stewart, Diego Oré
articles.description: Mexico has refused a request from President Donald Trump's administration to allow a U.S. military aircraft deporting migrants to land in the country, a U.S. official and a Mexican official told Reuters.
articles.title: Mexico refuses U.S. military flight deporting migrants, sources say

articles.author: David Lewis, Stephanie Van Den Berg, Reade Levinson
articles.description: One of Europe's most wanted fugitives, convicted cocaine smuggler Jos Leijdekkers, has found refuge and high-level protection in Sierra Leone, according to three sources with direct knowledge of the matter as well as photos and video footage seen by Reuters.
articles.title: Exclusive: European cocaine kingpin has high level protection in Sierra Leone-sources

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Officials at the U.S. Department of Homeland Security have ordered what amounts to a pause in several programs that allow immigrants to settle temporarily in the United States, the New York Times reported on Friday.
articles.title: US orders pause to programs allowing temporary immigrant settlement, NYT reports

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israeli forces will remain in southern Lebanon beyond a 60-day deadline stipulated in a ceasefire deal with Hezbollah because its terms have not been fully implemented, the Israeli prime minister's office said on Friday.
articles.title: Israeli forces to stay in south Lebanon beyond withdrawal deadline

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The top European Union military official, Robert Brieger, said it would make sense to station troops from EU countries in Greenland, according to an interview with Germany's Welt am Sonntag published on Saturday, as U.S. President Donald Trump has expressed interest in acquiring the Danish territory.
articles.title: EU military chief says it would make sense to put European troops in Greenland, Welt reports
